p: Comparatively potent activities against Fulvia fulva (Cooke) Cif., Alternaria solani, Valsa malicola, Valsa mali, and Salmonella enteritidis were identified in 1.59, 6.35, 7.94, 5.56, and 1.59% of the isolates, respectively. In contrast, all tested strains exhibited no potent inhibition against Fusarium oxysporum f.sp. and Fusarium oxysporum, and they merely showed moderate and weak activities. Of the 126 isolates, few strains showed high activities against human pathogens ( Figure 6). Strain T3SB005 revealed completely antagonistic activity against all the three human pathogens of which T3SB005 showed a sizeable clear zone of inhibition to Salmonella enteritidis (+++) ( Table 3).
